ca.mcgill.ecse211.team4.odometry

Class Odometer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.team4.odometry.Odometer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class Odometer
extends Thread
    Tracks the movement of the robot using odometry principles.
    Author:
    Walid Chabchoub & Kevin Laframboise

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        Thread.State, Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Odometer(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor, EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor)
      Creates an odometer object that, once the thread is started, will track the right and left motor passed as argument.

      • getPosition

        public void getPosition(double[] position,
                        boolean[] update)
        Places the current x, y and theta in the position array.
        Parameters:
        position - array to fill with x, y and theta. Element at index 0 is x, 1 is y and 2 is theta.
        update - dictates which coordinate to place in the array. Follows same indexing as position.

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Returns:
        x

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Returns:
        y

      • getTheta

        public double getTheta()
        Returns:
        theta

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(double[] position,
                        boolean[] update)
        Changes the current x, y and theta in to the value in the position array.
        Parameters:
        position - array containing new x, y and theta. Element at index 0 is x, 1 is y and 2 is theta.
        update - dictates which coordinate to update. Follows same indexing as position.

      • setX

        public void setX(double x)
        Changes the current x position.
        Parameters:
        x - new x, in cm.

      • setY

        public void setY(double y)
        Changes the current y position.
        Parameters:
        y - new y, in cm.

      • setTheta

        public void setTheta(double theta)
        Changes the current heading.
        Parameters:
        theta - new theta, in radians.
